intro: Schradera monantha, commonly known as the white schradera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Schradera monantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
